1. Control your blood sugar levels if you have diabetes.
2. Keep your blood pressure within a healthy range.
3. Eat a kidney-friendly diet, which typically includes limiting sodium, potassium and protein.
4. Stay active, as regular exercise can help control blood pressure and glucose levels.
5. Avoid overuse of over-the-counter pain medications, as they can harm kidneys over time.
6. Don't smoke or use tobacco, as these can damage kidneys and make existing kidney damage worse.
7. If you're overweight, work to lose weight.
8. Drink plenty of fluids, but avoid sugary drinks.

These are general suggestions and you should discuss any changes with your doctor. Does this answer your question, Mr. Oliver?
